website_summaries.verdict: This practical hammock comes with its own mosquito net to keep pesky insects from bugging you.
pros: Designed to eliminate pressure points, this lightweight hammock comes with tree straps and goes up easily
It's made with parachute nylon and includes mosquito netting
Comes with its own stuff sack
cons: Both the hammock and the net have been known to rip for some individuals who slept overnight in the hammock

customer_reviews.title: I'm bummed because it was very comfortable and the bug net was awesome
customer_reviews.text: Went on a 5 day camping trip and slept in it every night until the last night when it ripped from side to side and dumped me 4 feet onto rocks. Not for all night sleeping/hammock-camping. I'm bummed because it was very comfortable and the bug net was awesome. Now, because it's one week past the return time, I've got nothing and can not send it back. ugh.
customer_reviews.author: ABG603

customer_reviews.title: Swing and a miss.
customer_reviews.text: Crap hammock. The bug net is SUPER fragile and the hammock material is way, way, WAY too stretchy. I was obscenely disappointed in this purchase, fortunately I was able to return it for a refund. I even tried this with a friend of mine's atlas straps and it was still a bust. No matter how high I put this in the tree or what the tree spacing was like I always ended up crunched up or dragging on the ground, I'm only 180lbs - my buddy has an REI brand hammock and weighs 20lbs more than me and doesn't have the same problems.
customer_reviews.author: A Train

customer_reviews.title: Great Piece Of Gear
customer_reviews.text: The Blue Sky Hammock is a very comfortable hammock for the money. ( Did notice the price went up by nearly 20 percent here recently.) It is not expedition quality, but good enough to last a couple of seasons if one does not stress the zipper too much as you enter and exit the hammock. If you are intending to hike light, and you combine this piece of gear with a good light weight tarp, then you can not beat this hammock for value. Remember to still carry your caming pad to put underneath you if the temperatures will be less than 65 degrees or so at night.
customer_reviews.author: Lewis

customer_reviews.title: Kiss your troubles goodbye partner.
customer_reviews.text: I finally did it, I'm a home owner. Are you tired of crashing at your buds? Sick of dating boring girls just to have a place to sleep? Have you run out of excuses to tell your co workers when they ask: "Hey Merve, why is your deodorant and razor always on the paper towel dispenser in the basement bathroom?" Well friend, I too was like you. But not anymore!!!! Because I bought this hammock. Imagine the comfort and security in knowing that no matter what park you're in, intersection you're crossing, or hallway you find yourself lurking, all 6'4" 260lbs of you is home.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: It seems sturdy and strong enough for me to get in & ...
customer_reviews.text: I have not yet been able to use it camping or hiking but I set it up from post to post on my deck and tried it out. It seems sturdy and strong enough for me to get in & out (205 lb.) 6ft. Netting seems just what I expected, Zipper is good, made of metal. The only reason for 4 stars instead of 5 is it is double stitched and not triple. But still, the triple stitched Grand Trunk that I also own cost $70.00 compared to $43.00 for this one. But all in all, they are both pretty comparable to one another. And double stitched is better than single. I'm sure it will be just fine.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis Bernard

customer_reviews.title: Excellent hammock
customer_reviews.text: My son and I just spent a week at the Boundary Waters Canoe Area in Minnesota and these hammocks were great. We never had any problema with mosquitos and they were durable while providing comfortable sleep. I'm excited for our next trip.
customer_reviews.author: Jimmy Goheen

customer_reviews.title: Invest your money in a better product....
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this because of the price. I read a lot of reviews and decided it was worth a try. I guess you get what you pay for. First of the tree straps that are included are pretty much useless, so you might want to consider an upgrade for these. The mosquito netting is nice, the whole thing is easy to use and comfortable, unfortunately the seems ripped on the first one week camp out. While the person that used this is tall, he isn't heavy. At 6' 2" he only weighs 140 lbs.
customer_reviews.author: Minnesota Mother of 4 Sons

customer_reviews.title: Missing Tree Straps
customer_reviews.text: When you receive all the parts, this is an excellent hammock- which is now standard issue for the Boy Scout troop I'm associated with. Unfortunately, the three I received today came with only ONE set of tree straps. I know of no other way to highlight this problem (and potentially get the other two sets of tree straps) other than posting a review such as this! Hey Blue Sky- Where are my other two sets of tree straps!?
customer_reviews.author: David D Van Wagoner

customer_reviews.title: The best hammock ever.
customer_reviews.text: Seriously love this thing. All the comfort of these types of hammocks (which really are the best) with the added awesomeness of a mosquito net! Can be used anywhere and small enough to fit into any knapsack or backpack. I love it. Couldn't like it more. Nothing wrong with it. Great buy!
customer_reviews.author: Jessie

customer_reviews.title: Nettin' but Net
customer_reviews.text: Only used it once so far. Works as advertised. Just make sure that if you use a sleeping bag in it, you might get super frustrated. Nylon on nylon is super slick and doesn't allow the bag to stay in place making it super frustrating to get in and out, or making the space between trees very important that they are farther apart for a more level hammock. I would just recommend the company putting a thin spray-on grip liner on the inside so that nylon sleep bags will stay in place more.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Rust

customer_reviews.title: Great Hammock on a Budget
customer_reviews.text: Great hammock for the price! I used this on a week-long backpacking trip this fall and had no problems. However, I did buy different tree straps, so I haven't used the ones included with this hammock. I'm 6'3, 200 pounds and the hammock had no trouble holding me. The mosquito net worked great: there were mosquitos buzzing outside the hammock all night, but none ever made there way inside. Obviously, you need to have a tarp above you, but I would also recommend picking up a different pair of tree straps, at least as a backup. Also, if you're sleeping in it during cold conditions (≤40°), then I would recommend getting an under quilt or something similar.
customer_reviews.author: Justin Morrison

customer_reviews.title: Great way to Camp
customer_reviews.text: I just love sleeping in a hammock,only problem is bugs,so I am very glad I bought this one with a bug net,and it rolls up so small that it takes very Little room in my backpack.Get one and enjoy a good nights rest,there is even a way to hang hammocks without trees,it is on YouTube about how the make a simple setup using two wooden poles at each end and anchors .This is very cheap to make and you are set to hang a hammock where ever.you are.
customer_reviews.author: Edward B.

customer_reviews.title: but the quality seems good and the price is great
customer_reviews.text: **update 9/9/16** found out this past wk that my straps did not come with the hammock like they were supposed to have. took it on a trip, went to use it & surprise! no straps** --- can't give it a five star yet because i haven't gotten to use it yet.. but the quality seems good and the price is great.. will come back and update if i have a problem with it
customer_reviews.author: shellbella

customer_reviews.title: I did not like this product because it ripped very easily in the ...
customer_reviews.text: I did not like this product because it ripped very easily in the laundry and I have a brand-new Samsung washer so it was not the washer and the website said that it was washable so I don't think that it's very good quality if you want a good Hamock for camping I would invest in the Hennessey hammock.
customer_reviews.author: Walid Kilani

customer_reviews.title: Way more comfortable than a tent
customer_reviews.text: Very packable. Way more comfortable than a tent. I have used twice and slept soundly both nights. It could have been the wisky though. I plan on replacing the straps that attach to the tree the ones that come with require the perfect distance between and perfect circumference of trees. I think something adjustable like a ratchet strap would help immensely. Also not sure how watertight it would be with a tarp over it. I will have to practice different rigging techniques.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron N.

customer_reviews.title: Good quality hammock but has heavy ropes and straps that can be changed
customer_reviews.text: You cannot beat the price. I am traveling to South America and will use this hammock for jungle camping. The quality seems great but I have not put it to the test yet for durability. The reason I didn't give it 5 starts is because (like all hammocks I buy) they use heavy ropes and steel S clips. This hardware is great for the park or car camping but I always change out the ropes and it makes a difference when traveling ultralight. So get this hammock and change out the heavy straps and hooks and ropes. Great deal.
customer_reviews.author: anarchybike

customer_reviews.title: ) Loved it.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this days before a camping trip and didn't have a whole lot of time to get acquainted with it. My campsite did not have the proper sort of trees within usable distance to each other, but I was able to attach one end to a one tree and re-position my car to lash the other end to the top rack. Fell asleep for a few hours after a long hike :) Loved it.
customer_reviews.author: L. Nahay

customer_reviews.title: Loved my hammock and took it backpacking this weekend
customer_reviews.text: Loved my hammock and took it backpacking this weekend. It was awesome to sleep under the stars and have protection from the buggies. I slept well and even slept on my side a bit without feeling I was going to tumble out. Being in the hammock reminded me of the hot summer days and my pop would bring out the hammock so we can relax. We took the hammock with us everywhere that had trees. The park, the beach, the lake and camping out in the forest.
customer_reviews.author: Lizette Sanchez

customer_reviews.title: Overall I am very pleased with the hammock
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this hammock for a hot weather summer camping trip. Overall I am very pleased with the hammock. I give it three stars because the tree straps supplied with the hammock are worthless. I am 6' and 240 lbs and found my rear end touching the ground within 3 hours of crawling in the tent. The straps were set taught between the hammock and the trees and the hammock bottom itself was 4 ft. off the ground before I crawled in. The tree straps arrived as 6ft long and after 2 nights in the hammock the straps had stretched to almost 8 ft long.
customer_reviews.author: eclipsesd1

customer_reviews.title: This hammock works quite nicely. Is it very light weight and comfortable
customer_reviews.text: This hammock works quite nicely. Is it very light weight and comfortable. The strap it comes with however do not hold up to a 275Lbs occupant. The hammock itself does but the straps stretch and your butt will end up on the ground. Still in all a good product to buy just get better straps.
customer_reviews.author: Ray Gombos

customer_reviews.title: Boundary Waters Trip was great with this.
customer_reviews.text: Pair this with Ultimate Survival Technologies BASE Hex Tarp, Orange and you have yourself a multi-weather sleeping solutions for the outdoors. Used this at the boundary waters it was great. The straps that come with it are not very adjustable. But they are FREE. if you are looking for a more convenient option buy this and get the ENO straps.
customer_reviews.author: DanDriverUSA

customer_reviews.title: Overall I'd highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.text: Well worth the money for a solid product. Comparable to much more expensive hammocks. The mosquito netting is not removable, but you can simply flip the hammock over. The netting does not get in the way of use. I noticed a few reviews criticizing the tree straps. I have had no trouble with them myself. Overall I'd highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel M.

customer_reviews.title: other wise it was comfortable.
customer_reviews.text: Had to return the seam tore where the netting attached to the hammock, other wise it was comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Blankinship

customer_reviews.title: Very nice and comfy
customer_reviews.text: Very nice and comfy. Don't leave it our there though. Especially if you have kids. If they start jumping on it the net gets torn easily. Had a seamstress in the shop so had it fixed quickly but can be a bummer when you're camping.
customer_reviews.author: Serol Agazat

customer_reviews.title: Inferior materials and workmanship.
customer_reviews.text: The quality compared to my comparable REI hammock is vastly inferior. The zippers are cheap and snag up when opening and closing. While this is a great concept, the execution and materials used leave much to the imagination. I would not recommend this product. You will get very few uses out of it.
customer_reviews.author: Ken Lund

customer_reviews.title: My son loves it
customer_reviews.text: My 17yr old loves this.he often goes with his friends camping and they all bought hammocks. All different brands and all the boys are jealous over this one. with a bug net he is left without fighting bugs and a good night sleep. Going to buy another for my 18 yr old. No problems with hanging from a tree
customer_reviews.author: Adi

customer_reviews.title: Skip this one.
customer_reviews.text: Too stretchy. Hammock to strap fasteners didn't work very well.
customer_reviews.author: James Flippin

customer_reviews.title: Nice hammock
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what it’s supposed to be. Came with everything it said it would and showed up on time
customer_reviews.author: Katie Englehart

customer_reviews.title: Makes me feel like a sexy burrito
customer_reviews.text: Makes me feel like a sexy burrito. It's maiden voyage was the maryland section on the AT this past June, was great. Now it's about to go to the Dolly Sods, WV. Let's see how it does in cold weather
customer_reviews.author: Zack

customer_reviews.title: ... a net attached this is the biggest and most sturdy. I even fell off into the mosquito net
customer_reviews.text: Out of all the hammocks I have tried with a net attached this is the biggest and most sturdy. I even fell off into the mosquito net, no holes or tears. Great hammock. The size is not a double its bigger then a single though.
customer_reviews.author: Rachelle

customer_reviews.title: we were both very comfortable and slept well
customer_reviews.text: I took my 22 year old daughter camping and we both used these hammocks. With a tarp tented and staked over the top, we were both very comfortable and slept well. This city girl keeps asking when we are going back so she can sleep in the hammock again.
customer_reviews.author: Soap chick

customer_reviews.title: buy it
customer_reviews.text: My friend has an eno, I can set mine up faster and have less problems with bugs getting into the net. This one comes withe the bug net and the straps and free shipping! I have spent some rough nights in other hammocks, nothing compares to this
customer_reviews.author: Ray M.

customer_reviews.title: Well made and complete kit with straps, great value
customer_reviews.text: This is a very well made lightweight hammock. The kit is all inclusive with straps, S hooks, and mosquito netting. After testing in my backyard, this will be my go-to back country camping tent during nice weather.
customer_reviews.author: M. Soukup

customer_reviews.title: Keeps the bugs away
customer_reviews.text: It is lightweight and does what I bought it for, lightweight backpacking. Have use other double sized hammock, got this because of the netting. Feels like a cocoon, and the netting has an easy to reach double sided zipper. I use paracord instead of the elastic to keep the net up. Mine came with tree straps that I can extend with rope and carabiner instead of additional cost of adjustable straps.
customer_reviews.author: Shop and Save

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good!
customer_reviews.text: Pretty good!! Comfortable, but if you are in a hot place then it will get hotter inside the outdoors. In the other hand it does keep the windy air away from you. Enjoyed it,
customer_reviews.author: josh

customer_reviews.title: The netting also ripped very easily.
customer_reviews.text: The straps that it came with stretch very badly. I went to sleep about 4 ft off the ground, and I woke up with my butt touching the ground. The netting also ripped very easily.
customer_reviews.author: K. Reams

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: great hammock. straps were useless but the hammock is a way better deal than the name brands
customer_reviews.author: aaron

customer_reviews.title: Solid construction
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for the summer. My husband sleeps. In here and puts our 45 lb border collie in with him to sleep. Cozy, solid construction and bug bite free!
customer_reviews.author: PaintedLaS

customer_reviews.title: Too stretchy
customer_reviews.text: Way to strechy for me. Sank to the ground every time.
customer_reviews.author: John C.

customer_reviews.title: Love it! The most comfortable hammock I've ever been ...
customer_reviews.text: Love it! The most comfortable hammock I've ever been in. Easy to set up roomy enough for me and my 16lb Pug. Best of all not one bug gets through
customer_reviews.author: Barbra G.

customer_reviews.title: Very good but may need to modify.
customer_reviews.text: The hammock was comfortable and easy to set up, except for the fact that the straps slipped during the night. I will be changing the strap with thinner paracord by the next trip.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Wakeland

customer_reviews.title: Recommend this great hammock
customer_reviews.text: Great hammock, durable quality. Straps are a tad small.... Need trees to be fairly close together, other than that, this is a pretty awesome buy!
customer_reviews.author: ChristineDVA

customer_reviews.title: ... in the back yard and could not be more pleased. Easy to set up and ready to use
customer_reviews.text: Have not used this out in the wilderness yet but i immediately set this up for a test run in the back yard and could not be more pleased. Easy to set up and ready to use. Comfortable and big enough to accommodate a full figured woman.
customer_reviews.author: Cory Quinn

customer_reviews.title: Really great hammock the mosquito net is very useful
customer_reviews.text: Really great hammock the mosquito net is very useful. And the straps work very well and feel secure under full weight. Highly recommend. Order came on time would recommend seller too!
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: Where are my crappy straps?
customer_reviews.text: Product worked fine. Discription said it came with strap it did not. Even if some of the other reviews said it came with bad straps I still want them.
customer_reviews.author: Chef Thor

customer_reviews.title: This is the one you want! !
customer_reviews.text: I'm sure it's not as good as the high price spread, but I don't know how anything could be better, I love the price the fact it came with tree straps,and the great night sleep! !
customer_reviews.author: just me

customer_reviews.title: Good hammock for the price
customer_reviews.text: Low cost, sturdy hammock, very comfortable. I didn't trust the straps and bought Enos and better carbiner instead of hooks. They should leave these out and lower the price even more.
customer_reviews.author: Jack "LA" Lane

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Having issues with the zipper already and just got to use it..the net is a little claustrophobic feeling
customer_reviews.author: Dana

customer_reviews.title: ... a few hammock tents and for the price its nice, only issue is the strap's Included and the ...
customer_reviews.text: I have tried a few hammock tents and for the price its nice, only issue is the strap's Included and the s hooks. I used adjustable straps and carabineer's. After the first stretch did not move rest of the night....
customer_reviews.author: tim spearance

customer_reviews.title: Great hammock, needs longer straps
customer_reviews.text: All in all, great hammock. For the price, excellent hammock. The provided straps are kinda short, so I recommend getting some Atlas straps, but I took this camping instead of a tent and had no regrets.
customer_reviews.author: Mars

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: Works great, but the mosquito net is early torn away from the hanging loops and also the hammock body
customer_reviews.author: Austin J Mills

customer_reviews.title: Works great! Just as pictured
customer_reviews.text: Works great! Just as pictured. We've used it multiple times and left it in the rain and outdoors at times.
customer_reviews.author: Sherry

customer_reviews.title: The hammock is comfortable and spacious but unfortunately it is not as mosquito-proof ...
customer_reviews.text: The hammock is comfortable and spacious but unfortunately it is not as mosquito-proof as it should be. Mosquitoes bit me through the bottom on the hammock. This product is not going to work well in areas with lots of mosquitoes.
customer_reviews.author: Mahendra

customer_reviews.title: but we liked this one and had no problems with it
customer_reviews.text: I have not tried many hammocks, but we liked this one and had no problems with it.
customer_reviews.author: Kelsey

customer_reviews.title: It is comfortable. However the straps (included) are 'stretchable'
customer_reviews.text: It is comfortable. However the straps (included) are 'stretchable'! So I have to replace with the ENO's that I bought separately. So minus 1 star from my rating.
customer_reviews.author: Kang Wei Geih

customer_reviews.title: love this! I did end up buying better straps ...
customer_reviews.text: love this! I did end up buying better straps though. These didn't reach long enough for my trees. Oh well!
customer_reviews.author: Bellflower

customer_reviews.title: it's great! I know there are nicer hammocks
customer_reviews.text: For the price, it's great! I know there are nicer hammocks, but this one is cheap considering it has a bug net. The bug works well and is a nice piece of mind for sleeping out. I will be purchasing a fly and using this hammock on several trips. I used it one night already and despite it being a surprisingly chilly night, which is really the opposite of what you want when sleeping off the ground, I got a great nights rest.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher J. Livengood

customer_reviews.title: The netting and design are great! The price is great
customer_reviews.text: Bought two for gifts! The netting and design are great! The price is great, too!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I love this thing
customer_reviews.text: I just bought a rain fly to go over it. Nice and deep, well constructed and great design.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for what I needed..though I would recommend an extra blanket on the bottom if it gets cold at night. I wish it had a rain cover...tarps can get loud in the wind :) but overall pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Alison

customer_reviews.title: Nice and Comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I love the net on this. I don't have to worry about ticks and any other bugs falling on my. Light and solid.
customer_reviews.author: jzumbrun

customer_reviews.title: Ended up sending back because of the straps. The ...
customer_reviews.text: Ended up sending back because of the straps. The hammock itself is decent quality just make sure you get different straps.
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth Way

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: i love my hammock! Sturdy, stylish and the mosquito net is very useful and well designed!
customer_reviews.author: Urban Goddess

customer_reviews.title: Good intro
customer_reviews.text: It is very good for what you're paying. I bought it as an into for myself into hammock camping, and was very pleased. Sags a bit. Bugs can bite though the bottom, as they can for all hammocks. If hammock camping is for you, then like myself you will have to upgrade.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: great product & seller
customer_reviews.text: It came fast & secure. And it works great, in this heat & humidity the bugs are terrible but can't get to you in this hammock. I love it
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: ... never used a hammock before and this was very easy to setup
customer_reviews.text: I have never used a hammock before and this was very easy to setup. I would recommend getting a better set of straps, I got lucky and found a perfect setup that it wasn't needed. Net worked extremely well and it was the best night sleep I've ever had in the woods.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Lucero

customer_reviews.title: HAPPY camper
customer_reviews.text: It was everything they said it would be. Amazon Service was the best, they did a great job of getting everything I needed to be a happy camper. Hanging in my hammock.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: I really like compact it is and is easy to haul with you.
customer_reviews.author: L Currier

customer_reviews.title: Great hammock! The only issue I had was the ...
customer_reviews.text: Great hammock! The only issue I had was the straps that go around the tree stretched out so far I ended up dragging the ground by the morning.
customer_reviews.author: Frank H.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Very pleased with the comfort of this product. Price is great too.
customer_reviews.author: houa yang

customer_reviews.title: I love this hammock
customer_reviews.text: I love this hammock! It's easy to put up and it's nice and small when you aren't using it.
customer_reviews.author: Alissa Yax

customer_reviews.title: Dissapointed
customer_reviews.text: I was very excited for this. Unfortunately, the first time I used it, all 220 lbs of me ripped through, and I ended up sleeping in the mud. So dissapointing!
customer_reviews.author: Misty Hunter

customer_reviews.title: Returned it after one use
customer_reviews.text: This is so fragile, it is useless. And the net tore first time I used it.
customer_reviews.author: The Raptors

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to put up and comfortable for my frame. 6-2 and 220lbs.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Groenig

customer_reviews.title: Phenomenal product
customer_reviews.text: Love this hammock! The net is perfect too because there are so many insects in my backyard. The tree straps are a plus as well. Overall anyone and everyone should buy one of these.
customer_reviews.author: Aria

customer_reviews.title: LOVE IT! Only reason I didn't give 5
customer_reviews.text: LOVE IT! Only reason I didn't give 5... I haven't had it long and I am not fond of the S hooks it ships with.
customer_reviews.author: jamie

customer_reviews.title: Great hammock
customer_reviews.text: I love this hammock. The tree straps are a little wimpy. I love the bug net also.
customer_reviews.author: G-Man

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Buy your own tree straps, the ones that come with it a to short to fit around most tress.
customer_reviews.author: cb

customer_reviews.title: worked great, would love to see an affordable rainfly to ...
customer_reviews.text: Used it on a recent trip to the BWCA, worked great, would love to see an affordable rainfly to compliment the hammock. Easy set-up and take down, very comfortable...
customer_reviews.author: Dave Knoben

customer_reviews.title: The netting isn't very strong, and the first time ...
customer_reviews.text: The netting isn't very strong, and the first time I used it I put a couple of small holes in it.
customer_reviews.author: J. Kitzman

customer_reviews.title: Great: Supports my weight (260 lbs) with no problem ...
customer_reviews.text: Great: Supports my weight (260 lbs) with no problem bug net is a great idea Not so greats: straps absolutely suck. will stretch out about 1 ft each over night. had to get up and tighten because I was touching the ground. when you set this up and run Para cord through the netting to keep it up it seems perfect. as the straps stretch, it will rip the net. this can work great but buy better straps or use ratchet straps like I do with it now.
customer_reviews.author: Boone

customer_reviews.title: Good for the cost.
customer_reviews.text: Nice hammock. The straps are kinda cheesy or it would have been 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I got what I paid for. Solid and it worked.
customer_reviews.author: Jimm Brumley

customer_reviews.title: Very nice hammock. Took out the weekend it came in ...
customer_reviews.text: Very nice hammock. Took out the weekend it came in very easy to set up. Kept bugs off me while camping along the river. Very good buy
customer_reviews.author: travis

customer_reviews.title: Mosquito netting ripped
customer_reviews.text: Very comfortable nights sleep. Low quality mosquito netting seams. Ripped on first use.
customer_reviews.author: Jose O. Pacheco

customer_reviews.title: I love it!
customer_reviews.text: Haven't got a damn thing done since I put it up! I love it!!!
customer_reviews.author: Tom Buongiorne

customer_reviews.title: super happy with my purchase
customer_reviews.text: super cool, super fun to camp with hammock, light weight, easy to set up, great product, highly recommend
customer_reviews.author: lared

customer_reviews.title: Super light weight and great strength
customer_reviews.text: Used this hammock in Puerto Rico for over a week. Super light weight and great strength. You may want to buy extension straps.
customer_reviews.author: DLerma

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: Seems like a good purchase. Changed out S Hooks for snap links
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best at even twice the price.
customer_reviews.text: IT HAS THE SAME OR BETTER QUALITY THAN OTHERS THAT ARE TWICE THE PRICE.
customer_reviews.author: James Behrend

customer_reviews.title: The Hammock itself is fine, but the tree straps that come with it ...
customer_reviews.text: The Hammock itself is fine, but the tree straps that come with it stretch. They stretched over a foot on each strap, which put me on the ground at around 3am. I was able to re-hang quickly with some 550 paracord and a pair of carabiners
customer_reviews.author: BrandonW

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed. My husband is in the military and needs ...
customer_reviews.text: Disappointed. My husband is in the military and needs to sleep outside overnight 1-3 nights a week depending on his schedule. This lasted one night, not even before the mosquito net ripped. So much for the protection.
customer_reviews.author: red

customer_reviews.title: Seems ok
customer_reviews.text: Screen seems thin. Feels just like tent material. I don't know if it'll hold. Update:The skimpy screen material gets little holes in it that let bugs in.
customer_reviews.author: liv

customer_reviews.title: 5 stars
customer_reviews.text: Blue sky hammocks with mosquito net is very comfortable and Easley set up
customer_reviews.author: pire1116

customer_reviews.title: nice for the money
customer_reviews.text: great for summer camping, quick to setup, would recommend buying longer tree straps since there aren't always 2 trees at a perfect distance.
customer_reviews.author: Pen Name

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable, light, and strong
customer_reviews.text: The mesh bug fabric is fairly easy to tear but an other wise great hammock. Could have used instructions for tiring up the mesh.
customer_reviews.author: Torriev

customer_reviews.title: I hate to leave a bad review on an otherwise good ...
customer_reviews.text: I spent one night in this hammock and woke up completely covered on mosquito bites. The bites are only on my back and the sides of my legs and the sides of my arms. As far as I can tell they were able to get me through the bottom of the hammock. I hate to leave a bad review on an otherwise good product but the reason I got this was to keep the mosquitoes out. The hammock is comfortable and easily held my 230 lbs. But lotta good that does when I'm itching like crazy!
customer_reviews.author: Dweeb

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: split in half while I slept in the woods on a hike. almost froze to death.
customer_reviews.author: Laura Davis

customer_reviews.title: The knots that it came with were very short and ...
customer_reviews.text: The knots that it came with were very short and has a very short rope, feel on my butt from the knot loosening up and slam hit the ground.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Spitler

product_meta.title: Blue Sky Outdoor Mosquito Traveler Hammock with Free Tree Straps, Green
product_meta.description: Blue Sky Hammock's Mosquito Traveler Hammock is constructed of the same high-quality nylon as the Couple's Double and the Single Ultralight, but is also equipped with an insect net that will prevent even the smallest pests from disturbing your rest. The insect netting contains 2,100 holes per square inch, so whether they be mosquitos, no see ums, ticks, gnats, sand flies, midges, or fleas, you can rest easy knowing that the Mosquito Traveler Hammock is protecting you from these pests. The best part is, when insects are not a concern, you can simply flip the Mosquito Traveler Hammock over and use it as a regular hammock.
feature_bullets: Insect net contains 2,100 holes per square inch
Easiest and most comfortable Hammock on the market No uncomfortable pressure points or rope marks
Super strong nylon parachute material Convenient carrying case doubles as an equipment pouch
Soft, breathable, quick drying material Machine washable
Strength tested to 330 lbs; Measures 54 Inch wide by 115 Inch long
